revised_title: The Role of Phosphates in Yeast Juice Fermentation
tldr: The authors investigate the role of phosphates in the fermentation process of glucose by yeast juice. They find that phosphates play a crucial role in accelerating fermentation and that they are converted into a form not precipitable by magnesia-mixture. The study also shows that phosphates are regenerated through enzymatic hydrolysis, contributing to the overall fermentation process.
